page.title: 11HEALTH
page.content: There is no doctor, dentist or nurse on the island. There is a doctor on the Island of Eigg who comes out if needed but usually diagnoses minor complaints over the telephone. If there is an emergency a helicopter is called out or the doctor could charter the Eigg boat to bring him across. Basically it is preferable not to require medical assistance except on a ferry day so that treatment can be sought on the mainland. Dental treatment is similarly inconvenient. There are sometimes dentists among the National Trust work parties who visit the island who can give check_ups but any resident requiring treatment has to go to the mainland for it.
